newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Mosenergo still mulling raising authorised capital.
newsitem.headline: Mosenergo still mulling raising authorised capital.

text.p: Russian regional power company Mosenergo has not ruled out the possibility of a new share issue, a company spokesman said on Wednesday.
Mosenergo dropped a proposal from its annual shareholders meeting in April envisaging an increase in authorised capital of 800 million ordinary shares, about 30 percent.
But Natalya Khokholkova said the problem of how to raise needed investment would be discussed soon.
"We said then (at the announcement that the question of a new issue would be dropped from the agenda) that we need investment and we will raise that question in the near future," Khokholkova said.
She did not say whether an extraordinary shareholders meeting would be called soon to discuss the issue.

Mosenergo chief executive Nestor Serebryanikov said in April the company would not need to issue shares if it successfully placed an issue of Eurobonds and received a $150 million credit from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development.
Serebryanikov said discussions on the EBRD loan were continuing.
